alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 09 at 4:26AM EST until January 10 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Southeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Northern Coos, Northern Grafton, and Southern Coos Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 10 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Wet snow accumulations will add weight to trees and contribute to power outage risk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds are expected to be near and to the northwest of large mountain features. Locations immediately northwest of the White Mountains in the Upper Connecticut River Valley should prepare for strongest wind gusts.
info.instruction: Remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Watch for falling debris and tree limbs. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos
